alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 3:09PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... St. Croix River AT Danbury affecting Pine and Burnett Counties. .Heavy rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Croix River AT Danbury. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to spread into picnic grounds near the gage near Highway 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 7.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. However, additional rain and snow melt this weekend may cause the river to rise again early next week. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 07/02/1958. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon St. Croix River Danbury 7.0 6.8 Fri 1 pm CDT 7.0 6.9 6.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon by 200 PM CDT.
